verses.plain: Give ear to my words, O LORD, consider my meditation.

tokens.t: Give ear to my words, O
, consider my meditation.

verses.plain: Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God: for unto thee will I pray.

tokens.t: Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God: for unto thee will I pray.

verses.plain: My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O LORD; in the morning will I direct my prayer unto thee, and will look up.

tokens.t: My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O
; in the morning will I direct
unto thee, and will look up.

verses.plain: For thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness: neither shall evil dwell with thee.

tokens.t: For thou
not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness: neither shall evil dwell with thee.

verses.plain: The foolish shall not stand in thy sight: thou hatest all workers of iniquity.

tokens.t: The foolish shall not stand in thy sight: thou hatest all workers of iniquity.

verses.plain: Thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing: the LORD will abhor the bloody and deceitful man.

tokens.t: Thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing: the
will abhor the bloody and deceitful man.

verses.plain: But as for me, I will come into thy house in the multitude of thy mercy: and in thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple.

tokens.t: But as for me, I will come
thy house in the multitude of thy mercy:
in thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple.

verses.plain: Lead me, O LORD, in thy righteousness because of mine enemies; make thy way straight before my face.

tokens.t: Lead me, O
, in thy righteousness because of mine enemies; make thy way straight before my face.

verses.plain: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth; their inward part is very wickedness; their throat is an open sepulchre; they flatter with their tongue.

tokens.t: For
no faithfulness in their mouth; their inward part
very wickedness; their throat
an open sepulchre; they flatter with their tongue.

verses.plain: Destroy thou them, O God; let them fall by their own counsels; cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions; for they have rebelled against thee.

tokens.t: Destroy thou them, O God; let them fall by their own counsels; cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions; for they have rebelled against thee.

verses.plain: But let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee.

tokens.t: But let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee.

verses.plain: For thou, LORD, wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou compass him as with a shield.

tokens.t: For thou,
, wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou compass him as
a shield.

footnotes.text: bloody…: Heb. man of bloods and deceit
thy holy…: Heb. the temple of thy holiness
mine…: Heb. those which observe me
their mouth: Heb. his mouth, that is, the mouth of any of them
defendest…: Heb. coverest over, or, protectest them
